page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The area is typical of this part of {Suffolk,}with large fields of wheat and oil-seed rape, small woods used as cover for game, and scattered farms and villages. Farmers strive to retain the character of the land be planting new trees to replace elms recently ravaged by Dutch elm disease, and leaving some of the interesting hedgerows. The main road from {Haverhill}to{Bury St. Edmunds} (A143) passes through the area rerouted in 1939 when R.A.F. Stradishall was built. The site of the airfield is now H.M. Prison, {Highpoint.}Although very much a farming area there is a chemical works,{Wychem,}and a private school {Barnardiston Hall.}
